skill.name: latex-posters
skill.description: Create professional research posters in LaTeX using beamerposter, tikzposter, or baposter. Support for conference presentations, academic posters, and scientific communication. Includes layout design, color schemes, multi-column formats, figure integration, and poster-specific best practices for visual communication.

skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: The skill contains documentation and static templates only. No code executes, no network calls exist, and no sensitive file access patterns are present.

content.user_title: Create LaTeX research posters with confidence
content.value_statement: Research posters often look crowded or inconsistent. This skill gives clear layouts, typography rules, and templates to produce polished posters.
actual_capabilities: Explains how to use beamerposter, tikzposter, and baposter packages
Provides layout patterns and section structures for posters
Details typography, color, and visual hierarchy guidance
Includes print and PDF quality review checklists
Supplies a 36x48 HTML poster layout template
limitations: Does not generate or compile LaTeX files
Does not create figures or images automatically
Does not enforce specific conference branding rules
Does not manage citations or bibliographies for you

use_cases.title: Build a first poster
use_cases.description: Create a clean conference poster with proper section order, sizing, and visual balance.

use_cases.title: Standardize lab templates
use_cases.description: Define consistent poster layouts and typography rules for a research group.

use_cases.title: Polish a draft poster
use_cases.description: Improve readability, spacing, and print readiness before submission.

prompt_templates.title: Starter layout
prompt_templates.scenario: You have a poster draft and need structure
prompt_templates.prompt: Suggest a two column poster layout with section order and recommended font sizes for an A0 portrait poster.

prompt_templates.title: Package choice
prompt_templates.scenario: You are picking a LaTeX poster package
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare beamerposter, tikzposter, and baposter for a results heavy poster and recommend one with reasons.

prompt_templates.title: Print checklist
prompt_templates.scenario: You are preparing a PDF for printing
prompt_templates.prompt: Give me a step by step checklist to validate poster size, font embedding, and image resolution before print.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced layout
prompt_templates.scenario: You need an asymmetric modern design
prompt_templates.prompt: Design an asymmetric layout plan with a dominant central figure and supporting sections, including spacing guidance.

output_examples.input: Create a poster layout for a 36x48 inch landscape presentation with three columns
output: Three columns with equal width and 1.5 cm gutters
Header spans full width with title, authors, and logos
Results column includes main figure and key findings box
Footer contains references and contact with QR code

best_practices: Use 24 to 36 point body text for distance readability
Keep figures high resolution and consistent in style
Run a reduced scale print test before final print
anti_patterns: Using low contrast color pairs for text and background
Mixing many font families across sections

faq.question: Is this compatible with standard LaTeX workflows?
faq.answer: Yes. It provides guidance for common LaTeX poster packages and standard PDF output.

faq.question: What are the main limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It does not generate or compile LaTeX, and it does not create figures automatically.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my lab templates?
faq.answer: Yes. Use the layout and typography rules to align with your existing branding.

faq.question: Does it access my data or files?
faq.answer: No. It provides static guidance and templates without file access or network calls.

faq.question: What should I do if my PDF has layout issues?
faq.answer: Follow the PDF review checklist and verify margins, font sizes, and page dimensions.

faq.question: How does it compare to general design tips?
faq.answer: It is focused on scientific poster structure and LaTeX package specific practices.
